Evelyn Morrissey Betty Meyer Ron Payne David Carr Ronnie Bonnie Burns Michael Green Dorothy Dottie Mar bach Rick Cotterman Frances Carr and Kelsey Peters 2ND SUNDAY OF LENT FEBRUARY 25TH 2018 YR WE ARE INVITED TO KNOW THAT IF GOD IS FOR US NO ONE CAN BE AGAINST US My dear brothers and sisters in the Lord peace be with you all 1 Dear Parents remember to continue to encourage your children to make use of the Sacrament of Confession I will schedule for them during this Lenten Pe riod The adults Confession is fixed on March 7th Please make use of this Great Sacrament of Penance 2 Remember The Light Is ON for You an annual two hours Adoration with the Blessed Sacrament and Confessions in all Churches in our Diocese as directed by our Bishop Most Rev KC Rhoades it is fixed for February 28 2018 from 6:00pm to 8:00pm with Confessions from 615 to 7:15pm Evening Prayer follows then Litany of the Most Holy Eucharist and Benediction at 8:00pm Try to join and pray before the Blessed Sacrament Week day Mass be in the morning 8:00am So there will not be Mass that evening after Adoration 3 Remember that our Parish Mission Week is from March 4 Sunday to 8 Thursday Please leave these days free for the Mission Week Activities The program will be available soon 4 As you know we plan for Pilgrimage to the Holy Land to join in the Foot Steps of Jesus Christ It is fast approaching So consider seriously of joining us to the home land of Our Lord Jesus Christ You will never regret going It will help you to understand more vividly the Scripture passages It is from April 23 to May 2 2018 If you intend to go please call Ja.net Lehman (260)824-0367 or Stacey Cou lardot (260)466-1224 or Parish Office at (260)824-1380 or the organizing agency The Brochures are available at the Narthex Today is the second Sunday of Lent and I hope that everybody is doing his or her best to live in the spirit of Lent Try and prepare this Lent as if it will be your last lent and as if your salvation depends on doing it well We are assured that if God is with us no one can be against us Sometimes in life we can experience obscurity dark ness that can constitute severe mental pain and physical suffering It can be when we have doubt about our faith or when we are sick or when we have some problems diffi culties at home in places of work agony in studies name them It can also be when there is problem in keeping the values we cherish such love fidelity unresolved confu sion about things and persons around us Todays Liturgy deals with such problems and it will help us to cope up if we can turn to God with faith trusting that he will help us Thus in the first reading today Gn 2212 9a 1013 1518 Abraham is a clas sic example of man of faith honest and trust You can imagine the gravity of his psychic agony when he was asked to offer his only son Isaac the child of his old age He knew that Isaac was a miracle child and if God wants him Isaac God will still fulfill the promise he made Therefore trusting in God Abraham was truly ready to slaughter Isaac Timely God intervened and prevented the slaughter of the boy and said Do not lay your hand on the boy because you acted as you did in not withholding from me your beloved son I will bless you abundantly and in your descendants all the nations of the earth shall find blessingall this because you obeyed my command You see my dear brothers and sisters in Christ that If God is for us who can be against us This is the opening sentence of the second reading from the letter of St Paul to the Romans Rom 831b34 No one can really destroy us when God is with us and for us So let us be with the Lord that the Lord God will be with us and for us And in the Gospel Mk 9210 The Lord Jesus took Peter James and John to mountain Tabor there He was transfigured and showed his Divine Majesty He showed them his divinity to strengthen the faith of the three against the scandal of the Cross which Jesus was discussing with Moses and Elijah In amazement Peter cried out Rabbi it is good that we are here Let us make three tents one for you one for Moses and one for Elijah You can see the link of the Gospel and the first reading and Gods assured intervention in the second reading The agony Abraham experienced when he was about to slaughter his son and eventually Gods intervention and the Lords cruci fixion and the glorious resurrection are related You see that For those who loves God everything works onto good Like Abraham and like Jesus we must suffer physical and mental pains in our jour ney to heaven And like them we will overcome all those pains Let our prayer be God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change courage to change the things I can and the wisdom to know the difference cf St Francis of Assisi God bless you Rev Fr Pius Ilechukwu NB Heaven is for us all I hope you are doing something about it The amount needed each week to make budget is 511640 We are 37716 ahead of budget from last week Other Collections within our Parish St Vincent de Paul 44000 Bolivian Mission 99500St Joseph Womens Dues 7000 Diocesan Special Collections Central Eastern Europe 48500 Black Indian Coll 61800 the clay you are the potter we are all the work of your hand Isaiah 648 KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS ALL YOU CAN EAT MARCH 16 430730 PM ST JOSEPH PARISH CALENDAR FEBRUARY 2018 Wed Feb 28 The Light is ON for You Celebrate the Sacra ment of Reconciliation beginning with Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament at 6800pm Confessions from 615715 pm Eve ning Prayer follows Litany of the Most Blessed Sacrament and Benediction Try to join and pray before the Blessed Sacrament BIG THANK YOU To everyone who contributed to the Baby Bottle Campaign for Helping Hands Pregnancy Resource Center total of 141782 was raised to help young families in our community who have chosen life for their babies Gods Blessings to you all SIGN UP SHEET FOR PALM SUNDAY AND HOLY WEEK Trained Ministers are needed for Palm Sunday March 24 25 weekend Holy Week ie Holy Thursday Mass March 29 at 7:00pm Good Friday Service March 30 at 1:00pm Holy Saturday Easter Vigil Mass March 31 at 8:30pm and Easter Sunday Masses April 1 at 730 and 10:00am Please sign up in the narthex if you are able to minister at any of these Masses Your help is greatly needed and appreciated SUNDAY MARCH 4 STATIONS OF THE CROSS at 8:40am with the Religious Education Students We would like to extend an invitation to you our Parish Family to join us for Stations of the Cross on Sunday March 4th with our Religious Education Students beginning at 8:40am The first Sunday of each month Kindergarten through Grade 12 meet in the church at 8:40am to pray the Rosary together It is our 7th Grade Class turn to lead the Rosary but as we are in the Lenten Season they chose to lead The Stations of the Cross instead If you cannot join us on Sunday March 4th remember there are Stations of the Cross each Friday of Lent beginning at 7:00pm Open your hearts to the love God instills God loves you tenderly What He gives you is not to be kept under lock and key but to be shared Mother Teresa FEATURED SPEAKERS Fr Steve Colchin Lisa andor Fred Everett
